Package de.gnwi.jdpd.samples.interactions

Class ParticlePairInteractionCalculator

java.lang.Object
de.gnwi.jdpd.utilities.CellBox
de.gnwi.jdpd.samples.interactions.ParticlePairInteractionCalculator
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICalculator, IParticlePairInteractionCalculator
Direct Known Subclasses:
ParticleIndexPairCalculatorForTesting, ParticleIndexPairNumberCalculatorForTesting, ParticleIndexPairRandomCalculatorForTesting, ParticlePairDpdForceConservativeCutoff1Calculator, ParticlePairDpdForceDissipativeCutoff1Calculator, ParticlePairDpdForceRandomCutoff1Calculator, ParticlePairDpdPotentialCutoff1Calculator, ParticlePairElectrostaticsAdHocForceConservativeCalculator, ParticlePairElectrostaticsAdHocPotentialCalculator, ParticlePairElectrostaticsDpdForceConservativeCalculator, ParticlePairElectrostaticsDpdPotentialCalculator, ParticlePairGwmvvDpdForceFullCutoff1Calculator, ParticlePairNearestNeighborCalculator, ParticlePairPnhlnVelocityUpdatePlusGCutoff1Calculator, ParticlePairS1mvvVelocityUpdateCutoff1Calculator, ParticlePairScmvvDpdForceDissipativeCutoff1Calculator, ParticlePairScmvvDpdForceFullCutoff1Calculator
public abstract class ParticlePairInteractionCalculator extends CellBox implements IParticlePairInteractionCalculator
Particle pair interaction calculator that uses CellBox and the cell linked-list method to determine particle pair interactions that are restricted to a defined cut-off length. For basic concept and discussion see M.P. Allen and D.J. Tildesley Computer Simulation of Liquids Clarendon Press Oxford 1987 Chapter 5.3 The cell chunk parallelisation implementation allows the use of fast NON thread-safe objects and accumulation items like non thread-safe random number generators, non thread-safe double adders and standard (NON atomic) double arrays.
Author:
Achim Zielesny

    • ParticlePairInteractionCalculator

      protected ParticlePairInteractionCalculator(IParticlePairInteractionCalculator aParticlePairInteractionCalculator) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructor that clones aParticlePairInteractionCalculator (i.e. uses the same getBoxSize(), getPeriodicBoundaries() and getCellNeigbours() etc.) NOTE: getHeadParticleIndexOfCellArray() and getNextParticleIndexOfCellArray are NOT cloned but may be set manually with method this.setParticleCellAssignments() if available.
      Parameters:
      aParticlePairInteractionCalculator - ParticlePairInteractionCalculator instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if an argument is illegal

  • Method Details

    • calculateParticlePairInteractions

      public boolean calculateParticlePairInteractions(double[] aR_x, double[] aR_y, double[] aR_z, Parameters aParameters, ParticlePairInteractionCalculator.CellBasedCalculationMode aCalculationMode)
      Calculates particle pair interactions with a distance smaller than cut-off length based on calculation mode. (No checks are performed) NOTE: This method scales linearly with the number of particles.
      Specified by:
      calculateParticlePairInteractions in interface IParticlePairInteractionCalculator
      Parameters:
      aR_x - Current x-components of particle positions in simulation box
      aR_y - Current y-components of particle positions in simulation box
      aR_z - Current z-components of particle positions in simulation box
      aParameters - Parameters
      aCalculationMode - Calculation mode
      Returns:
      True: Operation successful, false: Otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if calculation mode is illegal

    • calculateCellBasedParticlePairInteractionsWithParticleCellAssignments

      public boolean calculateCellBasedParticlePairInteractionsWithParticleCellAssignments(double[] aR_x, double[] aR_y, double[] aR_z, Parameters aParameters)
      Calculates particle pair interactions with a distance smaller than cut-off length based on cell partitioning. Particle cell assignments are calculated. (No checks are performed) NOTE: This method scales linearly with the number of particles.
      Parameters:
      aR_x - Current x-components of particle positions in simulation box
      aR_y - Current y-components of particle positions in simulation box
      aR_z - Current z-components of particle positions in simulation box
      aParameters - Parameters (may be null)
      Returns:
      True: Operation successful, false: Otherwise

    • calculateCellBasedParticlePairInteractionsWithoutParticleCellAssignments

      public boolean calculateCellBasedParticlePairInteractionsWithoutParticleCellAssignments(double[] aR_x, double[] aR_y, double[] aR_z, Parameters aParameters)
      Calculates particle pair interactions with a distance smaller than cut-off length based on cell partitioning. NOTE: Particles MUST already be assigned to cells. (No checks are performed) NOTE: This method scales linearly with the number of particles.
      Parameters:
      aR_x - Current x-components of particle positions in simulation box
      aR_y - Current y-components of particle positions in simulation box
      aR_z - Current z-components of particle positions in simulation box
      aParameters - Parameters (may be null)
      Returns:
      True: Operation successful, false: Otherwise

    • calculateCacheBasedParticlePairInteractions

      public boolean calculateCacheBasedParticlePairInteractions(Parameters aParameters)
      Calculates particle pair interactions with a distance smaller than cut-off length based on cache. NOTE: Cache MUST already be set. (No checks are performed)
      Parameters:
      aParameters - Parameters (may be null)
      Returns:
      True: Operation successful, false: Otherwise

    • calculateLoopBasedParticlePairInteractions

      public boolean calculateLoopBasedParticlePairInteractions(double[] aR_x, double[] aR_y, double[] aR_z, Parameters aParameters)
      Calculates particle pair interactions with a distance smaller than cut-off length by loop over all particle index pairs. NOTE: No checks are performed NOTE: This method scales quadratically with the number of particles.
      Parameters:

      aR_y - Current y-components of particle positions in simulation box
      aR_z - Current z-components of particle positions in simulation box

    • calculateParticlePairInteraction

      protected abstract void calculateParticlePairInteraction(int aParticleIndex_i, int aParticleIndex_j, double aRij_x, double aRij_y, double aRij_z, double aRij_Square, RandomAdderGroup aRandomAdderGroup, Parameters aParameters, ParticlePairDistanceParameters aParticlePairDistanceParameters)
      Abstract method for particle pair interaction calculation NOTE: ParticlePairInteractionCalculator parallelisation guarantees that NO thread-safe implementation of random number generator or double adder is necessary.
      Parameters:
      aParticleIndex_i - Index of particle i
      aParticleIndex_j - Index of particle j
      aRij_x - x[aParticleIndex_i] - x[aParticleIndex_j]
      aRij_y - y[aParticleIndex_i] - y[aParticleIndex_j]
      aRij_z - z[aParticleIndex_i] - z[aParticleIndex_j]
      aRij_Square - Squared distance between particle i and j
      aRandomAdderGroup - Random adder group (NOTE: NOT thread-safe)
      aParameters - Parameters (may be null)
      aParticlePairDistanceParameters - ParticlePairDistanceParameters instance ((may be null)

    • calculateParticlePairInteraction

      protected abstract void calculateParticlePairInteraction(int aParticleIndex_i, int aParticleIndex_j, double aRij_x, double aRij_y, double aRij_z, double aRij_Square, double aRij, RandomAdderGroup aRandomAdderGroup, Parameters aParameters)
      Abstract method for particle pair interaction calculation NOTE: ParticlePairInteractionCalculator parallelisation guarantees that NO thread-safe implementation of random number generator or double adder is necessary.
      Parameters:
      aParticleIndex_i - Index of particle i
      aParticleIndex_j - Index of particle j
      aRij_x - x[aParticleIndex_i] - x[aParticleIndex_j]
      aRij_y - y[aParticleIndex_i] - y[aParticleIndex_j]
      aRij_z - z[aParticleIndex_i] - z[aParticleIndex_j]
      aRij_Square - Squared distance between particle i and j
      aRij - Distance between particle i and j
      aRandomAdderGroup - Random adder group (NOTE: NOT thread-safe)
      aParameters - Parameters (may be null)
